org.Spectrums

Class PRMSpectrum

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.Spectrums.Spectrum
      • org.Spectrums.TheoreticalSpectrum
        • org.Spectrums.PRMSpectrum
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<org.Spectrums.Spectrum>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccurateMassPRM

    public class PRMSpectrum
extends org.Spectrums.TheoreticalSpectrum
    This class transform a "real" MS/MS spectrum into a PRM spectrum based on a particular scoring model specifiy by the user. Note that in this particular framework, ascoring model is based on comparing a observed spectrum and a theoretical spectrum. To create a PRM spectrum we created a "artificial" theoretical spectrum for a particular PRM position and matched it to the observed MS/MS spectrum and then used the user-specificed scoring mdoel to compuate a score for each PRM position
    Author:
    Jian Wang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • removeSharePeaks

        public void removeSharePeaks(org.Spectrums.Spectrum s,
                    org.Spectrums.Peptide p1,
                    org.Spectrums.Peptide p2,
                    double[] prm1,
                    double[] prms2,
                    double tolerance)
        For mixture spectrum, when computing conditional probability we don't want to consider peaks from "first" peptide. This method remove a peak if it cannot find any annotation in the PRM model for p2 that explain the peak better than the current annotation for the first peptide (e.g p1).
        Parameters:
        s -
        p1 -
        p2 -
        prm1 -
        prms2 -
        tolerance -
